history.text: The reviews on this movie seem to be quite good, but the ratings seem low.
Yeah, how weird. I really liked it.
I agree.  I thought it was really good also.  I thought Rachel McAdams was very good.
She was great. Completely different from Mean Girls. What did you think of Gosling?
I thought he was very good as well.  He was very convincing and charming.
I agree!
James Garner was the best though.  What did you think of him?
He broke my heart. Gena Rowlands did too. Did you find their storyline depressing?
I wouldn't say depressing, necessarily.  To me, it was more heart breaking as well.
I guess that's true. Do you think the movie was an accurate portrayal of the 1940s?

I think the movie did a good job, but Gosling and McAdams seemed a little odd at first for that time frame.  I think they pulled it off though.  This was definitely a tear-jerker movie for me.  What did you think?
I'm embarassed to admit that I cried two times. Did you cry when they got separated?
For me, it was more so for the scenes in the nursing home when you discover the issues between Garner and Rowlands.
Yeah, that was so devastating. But on a scale of 1 to 10, how much did you hate Allie's mother?
Yah, that's hard to judge.  Do you normally watch movies that were from Nicholas Sparks books?
Nope. What about you?
I loved the fact that Noah finished the house for Allie.  What did you think?
I didn't like that. Noah was too obsessive. Were you super sad when Fin died?
I thought that was sad, along with the fact that Allie became engaged to Lon during that time.
I didn't mind them together, actually. Do you like movies with love triangles?
Sometimes, but generally love triangles frustrate me.  lol  I really didn't like Allie's mom.  Do you think Joan Allen played the part well?
She was great! There wasn't any bad acting in this movie, was there?
Not at all!  Everyone was great.  I was glad to see though that Anne gave Allie the letters.  Did that make you like her a little bit more?
I definitely felt for her! Do you think it was right for Allie to ditch Lon?
I think she would've been unhappy in the long run had she stayed with Lon, so it was good to go back to Noah.   Do you think she should have stayed with Lon?
No. Allie and Noah should have ended up together.
I also really enjoyed the scenery of Seabrook and Charleston in the movie.  What do you think of the way they showed South Carolina in the movie?
Very quaint. I think they did an okay job portraying South Carolina. Unrelated, but have you seen any other films written by Jeremy Leven?

uid1response.feedback: The response time was very slow and it became a little difficult to keep coming up with new questions.

uid2response.feedback: This was my first time doing this HIT, so I don't think I could have done better.
